requirement_tested: Frontend application with a dashboard displaying animal detection records
user_persona: A wildlife researcher checking recent animal sightings.
user_goal: To view a list of recent animal detections on the dashboard.

narrative_steps.title: Visiting Dashboard
narrative_steps.description: Sarah opens the website and lands on the dashboard where she expects to see recent animal detection records.
narrative_steps.action: Load the homepage URL.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Dashboard loads showing a grid of detection cards with animal names, timestamps, thumbnails, and metadata.

narrative_steps.title: Inspecting a Record
narrative_steps.description: Sarah notices a bear detection and wants more details. She clicks the card to investigate further.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a detection card labeled 'Bear'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: User is redirected to a detailed view page for that specific detection record.

narrative_steps.title: Loading More Records
narrative_steps.description: Curious about older entries, Sarah scrolls down to load additional detection history.
narrative_steps.action: Scroll to the bottom of the dashboard.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: New detection records are fetched and appended to the existing list seamlessly.

requirement_tested: Backend API service connecting to a PostgreSQL database using specified environment variables
user_goal: To confirm the backend can retrieve detection data from the database.

narrative_steps.title: Making API Request
narrative_steps.description: John, a developer, uses curl to hit the detections endpoint to verify backend communication with the database.
narrative_steps.action: Send GET request to `/api/detections`.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Server responds with a paginated JSON list of detection records retrieved from the PostgreSQL database.

narrative_steps.title: Submitting New Detection
narrative_steps.description: John simulates submitting a new detection entry via the API to test insertion logic.
narrative_steps.action: POST valid detection payload to `/api/detections`.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Server inserts the new record into the 'detections' table and returns success confirmation.

requirement_tested: Animal recognition system that identifies wild animals from uploaded images or camera feeds
user_persona: A field biologist uploading footage for analysis.
user_goal: To upload an image and get an identified animal result.

narrative_steps.title: Uploading Image
narrative_steps.description: Emma visits the upload tab and selects a photo of a fox from her device to analyze.
narrative_steps.action: Choose file and click 'Upload' under the image upload section.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Image is sent to the ML model via the backend and returns identification results indicating 'Fox'.

narrative_steps.title: Activating Camera Feed
narrative_steps.description: Later, Emma activates the live camera feed to monitor real-time activity near her research station.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Activate Live Feed' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: WebSocket connection is established and begins streaming processed frames from the camera for continuous detection.

requirement_tested: Color coding feature assigning unique colors to each identified animal type
user_persona: A park ranger reviewing alerts visually.
user_goal: To quickly distinguish animal types based on their assigned color codes.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Detections
narrative_steps.description: Ranger Mike scans the dashboard and sees multiple animal detection cards with colored indicators.
narrative_steps.action: Observe the dashboard cards showing animal names with adjacent color badges.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Each animal has a consistent color indicator (e.g., brown for Bear) matching the defined palette.

narrative_steps.title: Checking Tooltip Info
narrative_steps.description: Mike hovers over one of the color indicators to understand its meaning better.
narrative_steps.action: Hover mouse pointer over a color badge next to an animal name.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Tooltip appears displaying the full animal name and hex code of the color.

requirement_tested: User interface allowing users to configure alert conditions for specific animals
user_persona: A conservationist setting up customized alerts.
user_goal: To enable alerts only for wolves and set a high confidence threshold.

narrative_steps.title: Opening Alert Settings
narrative_steps.description: Lisa logs in and navigates to her profile to adjust her alert preferences.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Alert Configuration' option in the user menu.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Modal form opens presenting options for selecting animals, adjusting thresholds, and scheduling.

narrative_steps.title: Setting Preferences
narrative_steps.description: Lisa checks 'Wolf', unchecks others, drags the slider to 90% confidence, then saves changes.
narrative_steps.action: Toggle 'Wolf' checkbox ON, adjust slider to 90%, and click 'Save'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Preferences are submitted successfully and saved to the backend for future alert evaluation.

requirement_tested: SMS notification system triggered when specified animals are detected
user_persona: A local authority receiving emergency alerts.
user_goal: To receive timely SMS alerts upon detecting endangered species.

narrative_steps.title: Detection Event Occurs
narrative_steps.description: System detects a rare lynx with sufficient confidence level during night patrol.
narrative_steps.action: Internal detection process identifies 'Lynx' and matches active user alert settings.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: SMS is automatically dispatched through integrated Twilio API to preconfigured recipient numbers.

requirement_tested: Database schema storing animal detection records with timestamps and metadata
user_persona: A data analyst querying historical records.
user_goal: To extract all wolf detections recorded last month.

narrative_steps.title: Querying Database Directly
narrative_steps.description: Analyst Rob connects directly to the PostgreSQL instance and writes a query targeting the 'detections' table.
narrative_steps.action: Execute SQL SELECT statement filtering by animal_type='Wolf' and timestamp within last month.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Returns rows containing detection ID, timestamp, location, image URL, and other stored metadata.

requirement_tested: User authentication and profile management for personalized alert settings
user_persona: A new volunteer signing up and setting alerts.
user_goal: To register, log in, and personalize alert settings.

narrative_steps.title: Creating Account
narrative_steps.description: Tom fills out the registration form with his details and submits it.
narrative_steps.action: Fill in username, email, password fields and click 'Register'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Account is created in the database and Tom receives confirmation redirecting to the login screen.

narrative_steps.title: Logging In
narrative_steps.description: Tom enters his newly registered credentials and attempts to log in.
narrative_steps.action: Enter correct email/password and click 'Login'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Successfully authenticated; session token is issued and Tom is redirected to the dashboard.

narrative_steps.title: Updating Profile
narrative_steps.description: Once logged in, Tom goes to update his preferred contact method for alerts.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to profile panel and edit phone number field, then click 'Save Changes'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Updated profile information is saved securely in the database linked to Tom's user ID.

requirement_tested: Animal information pages displaying species details and characteristics
user_goal: To gather comprehensive facts about red foxes for teaching purposes.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Species Info
narrative_steps.description: Teacher Maria finds a detection record mentioning 'Red Fox' and clicks it to learn more.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the animal name link within a detection card.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Redirected to a dedicated species page populated with detailed info like habitat, diet, and conservation status.

requirement_tested: Real-time detection feed showing live animal identifications
user_persona: A nature enthusiast watching live detections.
user_goal: To observe ongoing animal identifications as they happen.

narrative_steps.title: Connecting to Feed
narrative_steps.description: Alex opens the homepage and sees the live detection feed starting to populate.
narrative_steps.action: Visit the main dashboard after system startup.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: WebSocket connection initiates and real-time detection cards begin appearing dynamically at the top of the feed.

narrative_steps.title: Pinning Important Detection
narrative_steps.description: Alex spots a rare animal and decides to keep the detection visible longer.
narrative_steps.action: Click the pin icon on a detection card.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Card remains visible beyond default fade-out duration and shifts to a separate persistent section.

requirement_tested: Alert configuration panel with options to set detection thresholds and schedules
user_persona: A wildlife manager optimizing alert efficiency.
user_goal: To reduce false positives by increasing the confidence threshold and limiting alerts to working hours.

narrative_steps.title: Adjusting Confidence Level
narrative_steps.description: Manager Dan accesses the alert settings and increases the required confidence score.
narrative_steps.action: Drag the threshold slider to 85%.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Displayed numeric value updates accordingly and prepares for submission.

narrative_steps.title: Defining Active Hours
narrative_steps.description: Dan sets the alert window to activate only during daytime operations.
narrative_steps.action: Use time pickers to select 6 AM to 8 PM.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Selected time range is applied and ready to be saved alongside other alert conditions.

requirement_tested: Browsing interface for historical detection records with search and filter capabilities
user_goal: To find all deer detections from January using search and filters.

narrative_steps.title: Searching Keywords
narrative_steps.description: Dr. Lee types 'Deer' into the search bar hoping to narrow down results.
narrative_steps.action: Type 'Deer' in search input and press Enter.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Dashboard updates to show only detection records containing 'Deer' in metadata or animal type.

narrative_steps.title: Applying Filters
narrative_steps.description: She refines the search by applying a date range filter for January.
narrative_steps.action: Open filter sidebar, choose January dates, and apply filters.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Filtered dataset reloads showing Deer detections exclusively from January.

requirement_tested: Responsive web design with misty rose background and firebrick UI elements
user_persona: A visitor accessing the site on mobile.
user_goal: To navigate the site comfortably on a smartphone.

narrative_steps.title: Resizing Viewport
narrative_steps.description: Visitor Mia resizes browser window simulating mobile usage.
narrative_steps.action: Resize browser viewport to simulate mobile dimensions.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Layout reflows appropriately with readable fonts, touch-friendly controls, and responsive grids.

narrative_steps.title: Verifying Styling
narrative_steps.description: Mia confirms the visual theme aligns with branding guidelines.
narrative_steps.action: Inspect background and primary UI element colors.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Body background is consistently Misty Rose (#FFE4E1), and interactive elements use Firebrick (#B22222).

requirement_tested: API endpoints for retrieving detection data, animal information, and user settings
user_persona: A third-party app developer integrating detection features.
user_goal: To programmatically access detection data and integrate into another platform.

narrative_steps.title: Fetching Detections
narrative_steps.description: Developer Sam makes an API call to pull latest detection records.
narrative_steps.action: Send GET request to `/api/detections?page=1&limit=10`.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Receives paginated JSON response with detection records including timestamps, animal types, and metadata.

narrative_steps.title: Getting Animal Details
narrative_steps.description: Sam retrieves detailed information about a specific animal for display.
narrative_steps.action: Request animal details via GET `/api/animals/red_fox`.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Returns structured JSON object with species-specific attributes such as habitat, behavior, and media links.

requirement_tested: Concurrent development server setup with npm scripts for frontend and backend
user_persona: A contributor joining the project team.
user_goal: To start both frontend and backend development environments efficiently.

narrative_steps.title: Installing Dependencies
narrative_steps.description: New team member Jordan clones the repo and runs the install command.
narrative_steps.action: Run `npm run install:all` from root directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both client and server dependencies are installed concurrently without errors.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Dev Servers
narrative_steps.description: Jordan now starts both development servers to begin work.
narrative_steps.action: Run `npm run dev` from root directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Frontend and backend development servers launch simultaneously, enabling hot reloading and synchronized debugging.
